channel.title: Adam West on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in Adam West on My New Hugo Site

item.title: The Four-Minute Villain
item.description: One of the best parts of the streaming era is that you can avoid watching a ton of commercials if you don’t want to. And in some ways, TV is responding to this change. Last year, Turner announced it was cutting back on commercials on its cable channels, and Fox—currently the market leader in commercial clutter—is trying to do the same. These days, 15 minutes of commercials in a single hour, give or take a couple of minutes, is about average.
